p: So far, a few methods of obtaining nanoemulsions with a low-energy method have been proposed, including spontaneous emulsification, phase inversion method, and solvent evaporation method, which perform well in the laboratory but not on an industrial scale [ 35]. Among the different literature reports, ultrasound homogenization is one of the most attractive methods for direct production of nanoemulsions on a larger scale [ 36]. However, comparative studies between scalable and non-scalable methods have not been documented enough. Even if numerous studies report the properties of nanoemulsions obtained with different methods [ 37], still there is no substantial knowledge about the possibility of producing a preparation optimized with a laboratory method, on a small scale, by applying a large-scale production method. This paper presents the comparison of the physicochemical properties of the optimized nanoemulsions as the media of the selected fragrance compositions obtained with a non-scalable PIC method, with systems obtained with a scalable US method.
